abstract: Panel investigating five Central Intelligence Agency officers' search of Senate Intelligence Committee computer network during committee's investigation of torture allegations against CIA clears officers of wrongdoing; panel concludes that officers acted in good faith in investigating what they considered to be security breach; finding overturns conclusions of CIA general.
lead_paragraph: The findings overturned the conclusions of the C.I.A. inspector general, who determined last year that five officers acted improperly when they searched files used by the Senate Intelligence Committee during its investigation of C.I.A. interrogations.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATT APUZZO

snippet: The findings overturned the conclusions of the C.I.A. inspector general, who determined last year that five officers acted improperly when they searched files used by the Senate Intelligence Committee during its investigation of C.I.A....

headline.main: C.I.A. Officers Are Cleared in Senate Computer Search
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Officers Are Cleared in Senate Computer Search
